Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cc-LTP1 (Coffea canephora lipid transfer protein 1, natural AMPs; plants; BWQ, unclassified)

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: Only the N-terminal sequence of this 9 kDa LTP is available.  Cc-LTP1 exhibited strong antifungal activity, against C. albicans, and also promoted morphological changes including the formation of pseudohyphae on Candida tropicalis, as revealed by electron micrograph. It is also able to inhibit mammalian alpha-amylase activity in vitro. Updated Jan2017.
Literature Information.Author: Zottich U, Da Cunha M, Carvalho AO, Dias GB, Silva NC, Santos IS, do Nacimento VV, Miguel EC, Machado OL, Gomes VM.2011
Literature Information.Title: Purification, biochemical characterization and antifungal activity of a new lipid transfer protein (LTP) from Coffea canephora seeds with ?-amylase inhibitor properties
